Review Text: I don't recommend it. I went to HCor three times. Once in November with a kidney crisis. I was attended to super quickly. The doctor requested surgery to remove the stone and place DuploJ on the same day given the severity of the problem. The hospital claimed it had no vacancy. It is especially the lack of information from the administrative staff - the PS sector did not have updated information on bed management and hospitalization - and these three pieces of information also did not match the fourth one - that of the surgeon's agenda.The third time - I placed the catheter and requested that it be removed 21 days later. I received a response from the hospital with the 'ok' for surgery only the day before at 5pm. Admission should take place at 9am the following day and surgery at 11am. When it was 10:30 am I hadn't even gone up to the room yet - I was in the hospital hall. They claimed they didn't have a bed. I went to the ombudsman's office and magically 2 minutes after my complaint a bed appeared.I went up to the room, my surgery was at 12:30 pm and at 1 pm I was already in the anesthesia recovery department. After being there for 30 minutes, without receiving any information, I questioned them and they claimed that there was no bed to put me in. They didn't have a room. I asked them to call the ombudsman. Nothing. The nurse called another department several times, which insisted on saying that they didn't have any room/bed to put me in. I will never set foot in this hospital again and I do not recommend it.
